title: Stabilize enum `is_variant` methods as const

labels.name: T-libs-api
labels.description: Relevant to the library API team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: A-const-fn
labels.description: Area: const fn foo(..) {..}. Pure functions which can be applied at compile time.

labels.name: C-feature-request
labels.description: Category: A feature request, i.e: not implemented / a PR.

body:
Recently const control flow was stabilized, which enables a lot of methods within the standard library to be made stable const; specifically all of the enum `is_variant` methods:

- `Option`: `is_some` and `is_none`
- `Result`: `is_ok` and `is_err`
- `Poll`: `is_ready` and `is_pending`
- `Cow`: `is_borrowed` and `is_owned` (methods themselves are unstable)
- `IpAddr`: `is_ipv4` and `is_ipv6`
- `std::path::Prefix`: `is_verbatim`

This issue aims to collect discussion about the stabilization of these methods, due to their similarities and trivial implementations.

## Stabilization
- [x] `Option`: stabilized in [PR#76135 ](https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/76135 ) (note: also contains `as_ref`)
- [x] `Result`: stabilized in [PR#76136](https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/76136) (note: also contains `as_ref`)
- [x] `Poll` stabilized in [PR#76227](https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/76227)
- [x] `Cow`: methods made const in [PR#76139](https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/76139), the methods themselves are still unstable under `cow_is_borrowed`
- [x] `IpAddr`: stabilized in [PR#76226](https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/76226)
- [ ] `Prefix`: stabilization proposed in [PR#76232](https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/76232), but there is not enough motivation to stabilize this method on its own
